intro: Cassipourea schizocalyx, commonly known as the flame tree or flame of the woods, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange floral bracts that resemble flames. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and elliptical, with a smooth surface and a pointed tip. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, three-winged seeds.
